messages.content: ComfyUI-ComfyCouple is a simple custom node for ComfyUI that helps to generate images of actual couples easier. It allows you to draw two different characters together without blending their features.
What is the difference between using ComfyUI-ComfyCouple and not using it?
When using ComfyUI-ComfyCouple, characters in the generated images maintain their own hair style, while without it, one character may adopt the other's hair style.
Where can I find the download or installation instructions for ComfyUI-ComfyCouple?

The installation instructions for ComfyUI-ComfyCouple can be found in the 'Installation' section of its documentation. You need to clone the repository to your ComfyUI/custom_nodes directory and restart ComfyUI.

To use ComfyUI-ComfyCouple, right-click in the workflow, choose 'loaders â†’ Comfy Couple', connect inputs and outputs, and provide two positive prompts for the left and right side of the image respectively.
What is the current limitation of ComfyUI-ComfyCouple regarding regional prompting?
ComfyUI-ComfyCouple is not quite actual regional prompting, which means there may be limitations in specifying the characters' regional characteristics.
How does ComfyUI-ComfyCouple differ from lasjdkf/attention-couple-ComfyUI?
ComfyUI-ComfyCouple replaced the mask magic of lasjdkf/attention-couple-ComfyUI with a comfy shortcut, simplifying the workflow.
Who contributed to the development of ComfyUI-ComfyCouple?
Contributors to ComfyUI-ComfyCouple include @laksjdjf, @pythongosssss, Meina, and Numeratic.
